_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

"Fundamental to Lubrizol's business is protecting our employees, customers, suppliers, contractors, and visitors, as well as the environment and communities in which we operate.  Lubrizol's culture of commitment to the continual improvement of HSES performance worldwide is a core value and an essential part of our success."
From: The Lubrizol Corporation Health, Safety, Environmental and Security Policy, October 2022


The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

The Lubrizol Corporation (Lubrizol) participates in Responsible Care(R), a program of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) launched in 1988.  Through Responsible Care(R), companies are committed to a continuing effort to improve the responsible management of chemicals. Accordingly, we believe and subscribe to the principles of the program including:

 - To lead our companies in ethical ways that increasingly benefit society, the economy, and 
 the environment.

 - To design and develop products that can be manufactured, transported, used, and disposed of or recycled safely.

 - To work with customers, carriers, suppliers, distributors, and contractors to foster the safe and secure use, transport and disposal of chemicals and provide hazards and risk information that can be accesses and applied in their operations and products.

 - To design and operate our facilities in a safe, secure, and environmentally sound manner.

 - To instill a culture throughout all levels of our organizations to continually identify, reduce and manage process safety risks.

 - To promote pollution prevention, minimization of waste and conservation of energy and other critical resources at every stage of the life cycle of our products.

 - To cooperate with governments at all levels of our organizations in the development of effective and efficient safety, health, environmental and security laws, regulations, and standards.

 - To support education and research on the health, safety, enviro

nmental effects, and security of our products and processes.

- To communicate product, service, and process risks to our stakeholders and listen to and consider their perspectives.

 - To make continual progress towards our goal of no accidents, injuries, or harm to human health and the environment from our products and operations and openly report our health, safety, environmental, and security performance.

- To seek continual improvement in our integrated Responsible Care Management System(R) to address environmental, health, safety, and security performance.

 - To promote Responsible Care(R) by encouraging and assisting others to adhere to these Guiding Principles.  

The Lubrizol Painesville Facility is registered to ISO 14001:2015 and RC 14001:2015 EHS&S and RC(R) management systems.   To achieve these certifications, a third-party auditor conducts a formal pre-assessment followed by a final certification audit in order to certify that our management systems are functioning and conform to the international environmental standards for ISO 14001 and the ACC Technical Specification for RC 14001.  

The Lubrizol Painesville facility has integrated health, safety, environmental, and security (HSES) responsibilities and accountability into the organization.  We believe that ownership is at the operating level and that safety is everyone's job.  We are committed to operating our facility in compliance with applicable HSES laws and consistent with Responsible Care(R).  This is the philosophy that we communicate to our employees and that provides the grounding for our daily operations.  We believe that this philosophy is critical to our progress and a key contributor to the continued success of the Lubrizol Painesville facility.

As part of the safety program, all new employees go through a safety orientation program. This includes but is not limited to the correct use of personal protection equipment, safe practices on the job, hazard awareness, and use of emergency

equipment.

A training program is in place to train employees and contractors to reach and maintain proficiency in safe work practices and maintain the skills and knowledge necessary to perform their jobs. The training facility, which is housed in a renovated old production building, provides employees the opportunity to train in a plant environment on safety procedures such as hot work, line breaking, confined space entry, and lockout-tag out.

Multiple layers of protection are developed and put in place on all processes to prevent accidental releases. Equipment is expertly designed according to strict engineering standards. Safety reviews are conducted on new and modified processes and equipment during design and before start-up. Maintenance and inspection programs are conducted and documented to ensure facility soundness.

Lubrizol's ongoing process safety program includes a measurement of performance, audits, and implementation of corrective actions. This continuous management of the system assures that safety is always the top priority.

If an emergency were to occur, we have a trained and certified emergency response organization staffed 24 hours a day to immediately react and mitigate the emergency. In addition, if we need additional assistance, we have an established working relationship and direct communication with the local Lake County Fire Departments.


The facility and the regulated substances handled:
 
Lubrizol Painesville is a specialty manufacturing facility. We are a leading supplier of performance chemicals to international lubricant, fuel, and industrial markets. Our processing areas consist of vessels and associated piping, valves, and other ancillary equipment.
 
All the chemicals listed below are used in processes to manufacture these products. 
 
The stationary source, Lubrizol's Painesville Plant facility I.D. number 0243000024, handles the following regulated substances:

Toxics:

CAS No.     Chemical name

75-56-9        Propylene oxide [Oxirane, methyl-]                         
302-01-2      Hydrazine                                                                 
7783-06-4    Hydrogen sulfide                                                      
75-15-0        Carbon disulfide                                                       

Flammables:

CAS No.       Chemical name                                                         

115-11-7       2-Methylpropene (1-Propene, 2-methyl-)                 


The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

Lubrizol's Painesville facility is in compliance with the OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and EPA's accident prevention rule. Some of the key elements are as follows:

For each covered process, associated process safety information is maintained, multiple layers of protection are in place including safe design of equipment, emergency and control devices and instrumentation, safe operational procedures, monitoring equipment, back-up systems, maintenance and inspection programs and an established training system for all employees. All of these mechanisms are in place to prevent an accidental release.

The five-year accident history:

There were no incidents at the facility in the past five years that meet the definition of the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) reporting requirements.


The emergency response program:

Lubrizol maintains an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) at its facility located at 155 Freedom Rd., Painesville, Ohio 44077. There is an emergency response organization (ERO) in place twenty-four hours a day consisting of an incident commander and trained emergency responders. There are also certified hazardous material technicians, emergency medical technicians, and technical rescue team on staff. The ERP is documented within Lubrizol Painesville's Intranet web site and is accessible to all Lubrizol-Painesville employees. The Plan

includes procedures for the notification of local fire authorities and the local emergency planning committee (LEPC), both groups have copies of the ERP. The Lake County Emergency Management Agency maintains a public notification and alert system capable of notifying the surrounding community as needed. There is continuous training of Lubrizol's ERO personnel on and off site and in conjunction with the local emergency responders. The ERP is updated as changes are needed.  The Lubrizol-Painesville Emergency Response & Security Superintendent is part of the committee that revises the Lake County emergency response plan.  A large-scale drill was conducted in November 2022 with Lake County Hazmat Team, EMA, local fire departments, partner hospitals, Lake County Sheriff's Office, and FBI.  The field evaluation for this joint drill was completed in December 2022 following the Lake County LEPC meeting. A tabletop exercise focused on a release of an RMP chemical is being planned with the Lake County Hazmat Team and members of the LEPC in July 2024.

Planned changes to improve safety:

An updated global health, safety, environmental, and security incident reporting system was implemented in April 2021. This system documents the incident and includes information on the root cause and mitigation measures along with the individual responsible for implementing the corrective and preventive actions. A system is in place to review progress towards completion of the corrective and preventive actions and to check the effectiveness.

Safety meetings and training are held on a regular basis to review these incidents to update employees on topics that will improve the overall health, safety, and environmental aspects of our facility and surrounding community.  Routine safety walks and procedures are in place to help guide employees to complete tasks appropriately.    
 
The site contractor management program has been updated to strengthen the sites pre-arrival contract service provide

r evaluation. This ensures contractors working at the facility meet all regulatory and site requirements.

A site wide ergonomics program has been implemented to help eliminate/reduce risk and musculoskeletal injuries. The program includes a cross functional team of employees that support risk assessments and awareness objectives related to ergonomics. Over the past four years the site has been able to eliminate or reduce risk on 146 tasks.

All the RMP covered processes undergo a process hazard analysis (PHA) in accordance with OSHA PSM and EPA RMP requirements to identify any potential hazards. If there are recommended actions from the PHA, projects are initiated to address the recommendations as part of the facility's capital improvement process.  Past projects related to RMP regulated processes have included upgrades to fire suppression systems and distributed control systems (DCS), level transmitters on vessels, replacement of liquid and vent piping, installation of safety barricades surrounding storage vessels, installation of sensors to detect a chemical release, replacement of metering devices on material feed lines, cybersecurity protection measures, and installation of additional emergency equipment.

These are some examples of Lubrizol's philosophy of responsibly maintaining a safe environment for its employees and the surrounding community.
